required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Open-label Extension Study of Relamorelin for the Treatment of Diabetic Gastroparesis

brief_summary.textblock: This open-label study is to assess the safety of continued treatment with Relamorelin for participants who previously completed the RLM-MD-03 or RLM-MD-04 study and to provide treatment for these participants until Relamorelin becomes commercially available or the Sponsor terminates development.

detailed_description.textblock: Active, not recruiting due to COVID-19

primary_outcome.measure: Proportion of adverse events in participants
primary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion: up to 5 years

primary_outcome.measure: Proportion of abnormal clinical laboratory values
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and every 3 months for up to 5 years
Baseline and every 3 months for up to 5 years
Baseline and final visit: up to 5 years

arm_group.description: Relamorelin 10 μg injected subcutaneously twice daily.

intervention.description: Relamorelin 10 μg injected subcutaneously twice daily.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Successful completion of either Study RLM-MD-03 or Study RLM-MD-04
- Ability to provide written IC prior to any study procedures and willingness and ability to comply with study procedures
- Demonstration of adequate compliance with the study procedures in Study RLM-MD-03 or RLM-MD-04, in the opinion of the investigator
Exclusion Criteria:
- Participant is planning to receive an investigational drug (other than study intervention) or investigational device at any time during Study 3071-305-020.
- Participant has an unresolved AE from a lead-in study, ie, a clinically significant finding on physical examination, clinical laboratory test, or 12-lead ECG that, in the investigator's opinion, would limit the participant's ability to participate in or complete the study.
- Any other reason that, in the investigator's opinion, would confound proper interpretation of the study or expose a participant to unacceptable risk, including renal, hepatic, or cardiopulmonary disease
- Females who are pregnant, nursing, or planning a pregnancy during the study
